comment.author: 13577983@N00
comment._content: crazy that i ended up on this photo randomly. i was born in beckley and lived there for 18 years of my life! i've never heard of fireco, though

comment.author: 45528944@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/usnationalarchives] I am so sorry that it took me so long to respond. My father was a coal minor who was born in Selma Alabama in 1909. He died at the age of 73 with black lung. He was a good man and the father of 20 children. 4 still born, one died of crib death and one miscarriage. He and my mother adopted me and raised me. They were the Patriarch and Matriarch over a large brood.

comment.author: 45528944@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jennisnead] It was a coal camp that was quite lively for many years. The mines had closed long before I was born. I have fond memories of growing up there.
